BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: PAUL DAVIS SYSTEMS OF THE CAPITAL DISTRI

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PARTS I AND II/PUBLIC CHARITY STATUS AND SUPPORT SCHEDULE:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: RUSSELL SAGE COLLEGE QUALIFIES AS A PUBLIC CHARITY AS A SCHOOL DESCRIBED IN INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 170(B)(1)(A)(II). SCHEDULE A, PART II (SUPPORT SCHEDULE) HAS BEEN COMPLETED TO DEMOSTRATE ELIGIBILITY TO REPORT CONTRIBUTIONS ON SCHEDULE B UNDER THE APPLICABLE SPECIAL RULE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INTENDED USES OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS: ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO SUPPORT THE EDUCATIONAL AND RESEARCH ACTIVITIES OF THE COLLEGE.

FASB ASC 740 TEXT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOOTNOTE RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS: THE COLLEGE HAS DETERMINED PRIOR TO RECORDING ANY BENEFIT IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS THAT IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE APPROPRIATE TAXING AUTHORITIES, AS REQUIRED BY THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES TOPIC OF THE FASB ASC. 740. A TAX POSITION IS MEASURED AT THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN FIFTY PERCENT LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON SETTLEMENT.
RUSSELL SAGE COLLEGE'S RACIAL NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY IS INCLUDED ON THE FIRST PAGE OF THE ANNUAL PUBLICATION OF THE COLLEGE'S CATALOG AND IS RUN ANNUALLY IN THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER.
THE COLLEGE AND ITS STUDENTS RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID FROM FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES UNDER VARIOUS PROGRAMS.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN - ANTIGUA & BARBUDA, ARUBA, BAHAMAS,
EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND & GREENLAND) - ALBANIA, ANDORRA, AUSTRIA, BELGIUM

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: ALL GRANTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AFFAIRS; WHEN APPROPRIATE THEY ARE ASSIGNED TO A GRANTS ADMINISTRATOR WHO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING ALL EXPENDITURES TO ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH GRANTOR POLICIES AND REGULATIONS. THE HIGHER EDUCATION EMERGENCY RELIEF GRANTS (HEERF AND HEERF-II) RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE FOR STUDENTS' FINANCIAL AID AND INSTITUTIONAL AID DUE TO THE EFFECTS OF COVID-19 ARE ADMINISTERED AND MONITORED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AFFAIRS, FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND STUDENT ACCOUNTS OFFICE WITH APPROVAL BY THE COLLEGE'S EXECUTIVE TEAM. ON A MONTHLY BASIS REVENUES AND EXPENSES FOR ALL GRANTS ARE REPORTED TO MANAGEMENT AND GRANT ADMINISTRATORS.

HOUSING ALLOWANCE OR RESIDENCE FOR PERSONAL USE: THE COLLEGE REQUIRES THE PRESIDENT TO LIVE IN A HOUSE ON THE CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE COLLEGE. THE HOUSE IS FURNISHED AND MAINTAINED AT THE COLLEGE'S EXPENSE. THE TOTAL ESTIMATED ANNUAL PERSONAL USE VALUE OF THE RESIDENCE IS $50,000 AND IS INCLUDED IN THE NONTAXABLE BENEFITS REPORTED IN PART VII AND SCHEDULE J.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 REVIEW PROCEDURE: THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS PRESENTED TO THE BOARD FINANCE COMMITTEE, AUDIT SUB-COMMITTEE AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR APPROVAL. IT IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR FINAL APPROVAL BEFORE BEING SUBMITTED TO THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY PROCEDURES: A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE IS REQUIRED TO BE COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY EACH TRUSTEE AND EXECUTIVE OFFICER. INDIVIDUALS SUBJECT TO ANY KNOWN, POSSIBLE OR PERCEIVED CONFLICT RECUSE THEMSELVES FROM THE DELIBERATIVE AND DECISION-MAKING PROCESSES IN RESPECT OF MATTERS AFFECTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION PROCEDURES: COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND TRUSTEES. COMPENSATION FOR CABINET MEMBERS IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AVAILABILITY TO PUBLIC OF ANNUAL INFORMATION RETURNS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: THESE ARE PROVIDED UPON REQUEST.
